clues.text: In this 1937 animated classic, the wicked queen tries to kill the title septet with a boulder, but it ends up backfiring
He's been known to try & kill a certain roadrunner with boulders, but the big rocks usually end up coming his way
In this 1981 movie Indiana Jones gets covered in webs while outrunning a large rock
clues.response: Raiders of the Lost Ark (*Indiana Jones and the Raiders of the Lost Ark)

clues.text: In a 2018 animated sequel, this superhero patriarch has to dodge rocks & stuff while trying to thwart the Underminer
In "The Princess Bride" this big guy, as Fezzik, dashes a big rock at Westley
In Sue Grafton's alphabet mysteries, "H is for" this killer crime
For his novel "Inferno", Dan Brown drew on a poem by this Italian
After a fatal stabbing in this classic mystery, Hercule Poirot asks for "a plan of the Istanbul-Calais Coach"
Time magazine named this Gillian Flynn thriller one of the "10 Best Fiction Books of the 2010s"
A review for this Ruth Ware bestseller set at sea says it "just may do to cruise vacations what 'Jaws' did to ocean swimming"
Hampton Creek, maker of "Just Mayo", convinced the FDA to let it keep the name, though J.M. doesn't contain these
A red flag that says "Since 1904" means you're using this mustard brand
Best Foods & this other brand of mayonnaise have the same ingredients & the same blue bow on their labels
Combining mustard & fruit, Mostarda di Cremona is often compared to this vinegar & fruit condiment that accompanies curries
This bulb is the key flavoring of the Provencal mayonnaise called aioli
It's the "T" in the name of the international alliance abbreviated NATO
When going on a journey, your ETA is this
Get there early if you hear FCFS, short for this
A college student may consult with this helpful member of the faculty abbreviated AA
In a car, SRS is this system that serves as a backup to seat belts; your airbag is one
After the completion of this feat of engineering in 1914, ships had an 8,000-nautical-mile shorter journey from N.Y. to Calif.
In April 1946 this international org. formally gave up the ghost, though it did give a lot of its stuff to its replacement
In 1991 the IRA attacked John Major & his cabinet with mortar fire during a meeting at this address, Major's residence
This future world leader was wounded in his attempt to assassinate the Iraqi prime minister in 1959
In October 1983 the U.S. invaded this Caribbean island & tourist destination; by December, most U.S. troops had left
In the 1930s Solomon Harper invented the electric curlers now called "hot" these
A massive atmosphere produces an enormous greenhouse effect, making this second planet the hottest in the solar system
Regarded as one of the hottest of these, the Carolina reaper is rated at more than 1.6 million Scovilles
In this book of the Bible, Shadrach, Meshach & Abednego are thrown into a furnace, but the intense heat does not harm them
Scientists at CERN using this device have created perhaps the highest recorded temperature ever, 9.9 trillion degrees Fahrenheit
Saying he had achieved everything he could in basketball, he retired from the Bulls in October
With Monica Seles sidelined, she won 3 of the year's grand slams tournaments
F. Griffith Joyner & T. McMillen replaced him as chairs of the pres.'s Council on Physical Fitness & Sports
Prairie Bayou won the 118th running of this horse race in Maryland on May 15
Marge Schott, owner of this baseball team, was suspended for 1 year for making racist remarks
To convert from Fahrenheit to this temperature scale, subtract 32 & multiply by 5/9
This unit of current is called an amp for short
The name of this biblical unit of length comes from the Latin word for "elbow"
This unit of length is 3.37 inches longer than a yard
Used in Britain to weigh people & large animals, this unit was once the weight of a good-sized rock
Idealistic, compulsive impracticality is called quixotism in honor of this title character
Muscular men known for their valor & prowess are likened to this Edgar Rice Burroughs hero
A swain enamored with the pursuit of love is called this, after the amorous young Mr. Montague
An unknown who achieves overnight success is compared to this heroine who wore fragile footwear
Tartuffery, a synonym for hypocritical piety, was inspired by his 17th century play "Tartuffe"
In the Northern Hemisphere it's the first month that falls completely in fall
In a sonnet Shakespeare wrote, "Rough winds do shake the darling buds of" this month
Elizabeth von Arnim's 1922 novel about this "Enchanted" month has been filmed twice
The names of 4 consecutive months end in this same letter
It's the only month that can start on a Sunday & end on a Saturday

rounds.comments: (Alex: Each correct response will begin with that letter of the alphabet.)

clues.text: This word is often followed by food, spa & insurance
This popular green-fleshed winter melon is a good source of vitamin C
It's the full moon nearest to the autumnal equinox
The lempira is the basic unit of currency in this Central American country
Samuel Butler called this bird "an egg's way of making another egg"
Crowned in Kyoto in 1928, he vowed to work for world peace
In 1911 Edward McLean paid over $150,000 for this unlucky 44.5-carat blue diamond
In 1926 Jozef Pilsudski took dictatorial control of this country
This woman who allegedly murdered her parents with an ax in 1892 died in 1927
This rival of Stalin was exiled to Alma-Ata in Kazakhstan in 1928

rounds.text: A cocktail, an island & a WWII venture originally called "Development of Substitute Materials" all bear this name
